reviews.text: she actually improved a lot since the start of when she started teaching at lowell. she is getting better at being clear about assignments (which she was lacking of the semester before) there is an ok amount of work (maybe average for a lowell class) and she is overall very nice to all her students.

unclear instructions, but class itself was pretty easy. a lot of projects but not a lot of daily homework. had her during her first semester at lowell, not your best option though. make sure to actually read romeo and juliet, she tested us and let's say not everyone did so well. also essays/paragraphs, have a good argument or she'll mark you down. kind of a tough grader on projects too. make things look neat. if it's something small that you think can be fixed, go talk to her and she'll give a few points back on your grade. she rounded my grade up to an A for one of the grading periods and got an A for the semester. good luck :)
Oh nah if u take her its commonly accepted that you had last pick.
